arm_group.description: Every patient undergoing trigeminal thermal coagulation of the Gasserian ganglion will be ventilated by a nasopharyngeal placed ID 5mm tube during the whole neurosurgical intervention.

brief_summary.textblock:
Airway management of patients undergoing thermal coagulation of the Gasserian ganglion is
      very delicate. This is because of the specific operation site and moreover patients should
      recover quickly from anesthesia to follow verbal intraoperative commands of the surgeon.
      Endotracheal intubation or laryngeal mask of course hinders the patient from speaking. An
      obvious alternative airway management, as performed in this preliminary study, is a
      nasopharyngeal placed tube.

      The purpose of the present study is to objectify the gas exchange in patients during this
      new ventilation technique.

clinical_study.brief_title: Airway Management for Trigeminal Thermal Coagulation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        - Patients undergoing thermal coagulation of the Gasserian ganglion

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Body weight over 100 kg

          -  Recurrent nasal bleeding

          -  Patients suffering from reflux disease

          -  Additional risk of aspiration (e.g. hernia diaphragmalis)

keyword: thermal coagulation of the Gasserian ganglion
clinical_study.official_title: Airway Management in Patients Undergoing Thermal Ganglion Gasseri Coagulation, a New Method - Preliminary Results

primary_outcome.description: Blood gas analyses will be determined at three time points perioperatively. The first measurement, at base line, will be performed preoperatively, the second one after puncture of the Gasserian ganglion and the third during the thermal coagulation of the Gasserian ganglion.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Before and during the neurosurgical intervention

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
